thread.title: Why Gertrude Stein’s ‘No There There’ Is Everywhere

author: Ben Zimmer
title: Why Gertrude Stein’s ‘No There There’ Is Everywhere
text:
How do you diminish a claim as insubstantial or meritless these days? One popular turn of phrase—now bordering on a cliché—borrows from the writer Gertrude Stein: “There is no there there.”
The seemingly paradoxical expression has been popping up all over the political landscape. Last week, a federal judge threw out several charges of bribery against New Jersey Sen. Bob Menendez, saying, “There is no there there.” (The Justice Department decided to abandon the case against Mr. Menendez after the ruling.)
